website_summaries.verdict: The Samsung SSD 860 Pro offers outstanding endurance ratings and on-point SATA speed, but deal seekers who need a 2.5-inch solid state drive for everyday use can find cheaper alternatives.
pros: Available in five capacities, up to 4TB

customer_reviews.title: Arrived today and it's pretty awesome. I've tried 7
customer_reviews.text: Arrived today and it's pretty awesome. I've tried 7, maybe 8 or so different brands of SSD drives, and various models within those brands over the years, and have to say that once again going with a Samsung doesn't disappoint. This Pro model is fast and snappy. Of the 2 testing programs I use the 860 Pro has outscored everything else i've ever tested. Simply awesome.
customer_reviews.author: R. C.

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Blazing fast. Boot up time for a 2011 MacBook Pro is now about 10 seconds from “Off” to signing in, and another 10 seconds until opening an app. No more bouncing icons - click and it opens. Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Don't understand why they changed the warranty from 10 years to 5 years. Hmmmmmm
customer_reviews.author: Solar Specialist

customer_reviews.title: It's fast
customer_reviews.text: I already own an 850 Pro in my Win 7 Desktop which is fast so I decided to get the 860 Pro so I could clone my 850 to it. I don't think anyones drive is faster. It's interesting that the 860 is cheaper than the 850.
customer_reviews.author: Bob G.

customer_reviews.title: Fast, but NO Power loss protection.
customer_reviews.text: Fast, but NO Power loss protection. I was unaware of this at the time of my purchase. I wish I had purchased a Samsung solid-state drive that incorporates power loss protection. A UPS (Uninterruptible Power Supply) is of some help, however, if the power supply, motherboard, or disk controller has a power glitch your data may be at risk. Other SSDs (including Samsung’s enterprise units) feature full power loss protection with backup power circuitry in the form of tantalum capacitors.
customer_reviews.author: Skyhawk

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but make sure you check on EVO first
customer_reviews.text: Works fine and is super fast. However, for my uses, the EVO would have worked just as well for half the cost. I wish I had done better research. The PRO series used to have a 10 year warranty, but Samsung slashed it to be the same as EVO now for this series (5 years).
customer_reviews.author: cdaug

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but worth it for speed and peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I have been collecting data for scientific research over several years (I'm a retired professor but still active in zoology research) and my older 2Tb SSD was almost filled up. I chose this drive, a Samsung V-NAND 860 Pro (red label) MZ76P4TO, because, in despite its high cost, among the alternative several 4 Tb models I had read that this had the highest reputation combining reliability and fast data manipulation and analysis -- although I use a very fast (gaming level) desktop computer, each data analysis step takes many hours. It seems that this SSD is living up to its reputation, and hope that it will remain so in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Ken C

customer_reviews.title: Good, but probably not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This product boasts a slightly higher transfer rate and longer lifetime for double the price of the evo equivalent. I have several evos that have been constantly used for the past 4 years and have no issues. Perhaps these are more durable and last longer than the evos, but realistically I do not see having the same high speed storage medium for long enough to experience this. I would suggest getting the M2 version of this instead. The transfer rates are much higher and it is in the same price range.
customer_reviews.author: Beta tester

customer_reviews.title: WHAT I RECEIVED IS NOT THE MODEL LISTED!!
customer_reviews.text: Seller states SSD is Model MZ-76P4T0BW. I received three SSD Model MZ-76P4T0B/EU which is Europe-only model, not sold nor warrantied by Samsung US, only Samsung Europe. Waiting for reply from seller but meanwhile not very happy!
customer_reviews.author: PMI

customer_reviews.title: Ordered PRO.  Received QVO.
customer_reviews.text: The white product label doesn’t match the product box. The white label is for the ‘PRO’ model and the manufacturer's label and box are for the value priced ‘QVO’ model which is over $100 less.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W

customer_reviews.title: Samsung 860 PRO 256GB 2.5 SATA III
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a present for my dad who was complaining of a slow computer, even after fresh installs. Upgraded his memory a year or so ago, and that helped. Bought him this, he transferred over his existing OS, and couldn't believe how fast his computer was! He is so happy that he didn't have to buy a new computer, and now his computer operates like it's brand new again - only better because boot and load times are astronomically faster! Best bday present ever :)
customer_reviews.author: randy21mTop Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: Fast and affordable!
customer_reviews.text: The prices of these SSD's these days is incredibly low for the value you get. Resurrect your old computer if it has a platter drive rather than buy a new one. My i7 4700MQ system is working fantastically well with this drive on Windows 10. I don't play games or do anything too intensive, but for your generic use I am sure this computer will last another seven years.
customer_reviews.author: Broc

customer_reviews.title: High durability, high capacity SSD
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for this combination. As SSD capacities increase and prices come down, vendors have been moving to TLC and QLC, but not increasing durability. Now we're finally getting good options for increased durability by (typically) going back to MLC. This particular model (860 Pro 4TB) has a 4.8PB durability and a 5-year warranty which makes it perfect for my needs. So far after a month and a half of use I am definitely maintaining my 5-star rating. 9.3TB bytes written so far, life remaining still 99%. We use it to maintain a very large index of open source source code... around 42 million files eating around a terrabyte (compressed). Flawless operation so far. -Matt
customer_reviews.author: M. Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Speed and durability
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I have purchased several Samsung PRO SSDs. They are all still working: Fast, dependable and trustworthy. I will not even try other options. My data is too precious. Make no mistake: I have tried other brands, only to find my fingers burnt!
customer_reviews.author: Tukkie

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I attempted to install this drive (1T) multiple ways and in two different laptops and one desktop. All modes resulted in the same result; the drive was not recognized. I don't know if the drive was defective when built or if it was somehow passed through a magnetic barrier or what but it was defective right out of the box. Might just be one of those unlucky 2%. Returned, refund recieved. Researching alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Killed my slow PC
customer_reviews.text: It may be coincidence, but my Intel 6100 CPU computer died shortly after installing it. I figure it's because it was a cheap Dell pre-built and couldn't handle the speed. Seemed more sluggish after installing before the PC died and wouldn't boot from anything. But then I put it in a Xeon server and it's much faster than the OCZ Trion and Intel SSDSC2BP240G4 that was installed previously. Just quick as ****. Performing compilation operations were once staggered in speed, now it's smooth. Really great purchase. Go for the PRO edition of this SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Byte USA

customer_reviews.title: Lame expect quietness
customer_reviews.text: Very noises reminds me of dos but lag on Mac OS Java something it’s noisy again I could not get replacement from seller while this was struggle I had repair portion in mountain lion while high Sierra thumb drive time machine then updated windows 10 and I think rpm fan noises may cause issues considering price expensive expect like car new quiet.... I have ram too 16gb... mid 2012 Mac user using boot camp windows 10 and new apple os that’s beta on java
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S, Vecchitto

customer_reviews.title: Samsung, simply the best you can buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently built a very high end desktop computer to run medical research projects, advanced CAD and other software. I carefully researched and selected the very best components for this system. I purchased Samsung 860 Pro SSD drives because of their speed and especially for their reliability. Samsung makes the best SSD drives in the world. They are definitely not the cheapest but you get what you pay for. The 5 year warranty and 2400 TBW speak to their superior construction. They are super fast and greatly complement the other high end hardware I put into my build. I am looking forward to many years of reliable use. You can't go wrong with Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: This is a FAST drive. It's worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up an external drive reader, an iDsonix IDDEU3101 2.5/3/5" SATA HDD docking station, laid the 850 PRO drive in the external drive and hooked to an old junk Dell E5530 I had upgraded to Win 10. Downloaded the Samsung Data Migration software (not Magician). Copied the drive over. Swapped out the old drive. Rebooted. It took like 15 minutes and worked great. The laptop is now easily 2-4 times faster booting and doing anything that requires or uses the hard drive (doesn't speed up CPU, WiFi card speed, or memory of course)
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Steve Jobs can Rest in Peace
customer_reviews.text: This turned a boggy iMac 16,2 from a machine of great boredom into a total rocket-ship. The install is easy peasy, nothing to fuss about if you can follow a Lasagna recipe. Tim Cook, iffen you're readin' this...you should never have let that machine (4K iMac 21.5) out of the door with a fricken' 5,400rpm spinnin' disk hard drive. Steve rolled over in his grave when I started using it. When I installed this SSD Steve was able to go back to restin' in peace.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Runge

customer_reviews.title: Best upgrade for an old laptop
customer_reviews.text: This is easily the best upgrade you can do for a slow old upgradeable laptop. I in no way am a computer guru but this thing is easy to install and set up. I installed the 256GB SSD into my 11 year old HP dv7 and it made a massive improvement on how fast everything runs now. In addition to this upgrade I also went from the original 4GB of ram to 8GB which made a big difference as well. I would highly recommend installing one of these SSD as your main HD to upgrade an old laptop that may be running really slow instead of spending a bunch of money on a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Romero

customer_reviews.title: A repeat buy based on previous Samsung product...
customer_reviews.text: I've had Samsung's 500 GB version of this drive in my desktop PC for 3 years now and it's still performing with impeccable reliability and no evidence of degradation. I have another on which has been running in my wife's laptop for two years with similarly reliable and speedy performance. I bought this terabyte version for my new ASUSTOR NAS server and am similarly impressed with its speed, reliability and a setup with no surprises. When it comes to data storage, I'm not looking for surprises. I would not trust a no name product with my irreplaceable data, and so far none of my Samsung products has ever disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Langsford

customer_reviews.title: Awesome drives - blistering speeds
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded every Optiplex and HP model we have - from years 2006-2018. Super fast drives and Samsung software is by far the easiest cloning software. You'll want to go Office Space on your mechanical drive after switching to a Pro drive. Upgrade your BIOS, download the Samsung software, use your DVD cables to temporarily install the drive for cloning, clone it, buy a Corsair 2.5" adapter for the Dell drive carrier (fits all Optiplex models), stick it in, cry tears of happiness as your privacy is robbed 100x faster!
customer_reviews.author: TCMA

customer_reviews.title: great product it was what the PC needed.
customer_reviews.text: Still no problems at all very amazing hardrive great quality product. Planning on getting more for other portable laptops very pleased with this purchase. For now the drive is working amazing. Upgrading to SSD has resolved all the sluggish and random rebooting problems with my PC. Is am amazing drive.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if there is anything better than that SSD. I did try over 10 different brands and over 50 different models. This is my personal choice. The cheap SSD does not even have a software to monitor the drive. If you are using HDD and never try SSD I will really suggest to get this one and see the difference. It is like a light and day. If your computer boots in over 30 seconds then is a time for upgrade. You may have the best computer in the world but if you do not have SSD you computer will not perform good at all. This is the best drive ever!
customer_reviews.author: mr. Y. G.

customer_reviews.title: Top  product at over the top price
customer_reviews.text: Let's begin by admitting that it is the fastest by microseconds, and you can sometimes see it. This past month, I bought 2 ssd, a 3D 1TB and an 860 pro 512GB. I removed the 3D from my notebook (elitebook 2570P, i7-3520M, 16GB ). I did not need the size/capacity of the 3D. I bought it for my daughter who has an old sandisk 210 almost full. I just tried it for a week. Clone back the 3D to the 860 pro an now running like that since a week. The fantastic deal/steal is the 3D for about the same price at twice the size.
customer_reviews.author: Franki

customer_reviews.title: Overkill... in a good way
customer_reviews.text: Given the number of ultra-cheap ssd storage options out there - this device really is overkill for most people. But when you absolutely cannot suffer data loss and need your ssd to perform without failure - this is the one to get. I have a 1tb on my workstation and 2tb on my work laptop. I never worry about data loss.
customer_reviews.author: RoyInHouston

customer_reviews.title: Best Desktop Computer Upgrade Ever
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to upgrade my desktop computer from a mechanical rotating hard disk drive to the newer Solid State Drive (SSD) technology for speed and reliability reasons. This Samsung Professional-grade unit installed without a hitch the first time and has worked flawlessly ever since. Boot times are much improved and everything is now much more responsive with this single upgrade. Very satisfied with this purchase. I chose the Professional line of SSD drive for its longer warranty and much greater overall life expectancy. My older desktop computer now performs better that it did when it was new.
customer_reviews.author: Nell C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect with my iMac 13.2
customer_reviews.text: This 4TB works perfectly in my iMac 13.2 late 2012. Before, I had a 2tb from owc and for some reasons it started having issues, I could not reinstall catalina. Tried everything even reformatting outside the iMac. Anyways I decided to buy the Samsung. It is very expensive but it is worth spending the money on the best product when storage quality and reliability is critical. Reinstalling catalina went very well. All great!
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas CC

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: This is my third purchase of a Samsung Pro SSD. Been very pleased. First the 840, then 850 and now 860, for three different computers. And after 13305 GB have been written on the older 840, Crystal Disk info 8.0 still reports that it (and also the 850) is still working fine. See screen capture snips.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Fakenstein Used SSD - Be aware
customer_reviews.text: Bough a used one good condition one. I figured out that if the things passed my quality control it would be worth the price. When I plugged into Samsung Magician it was not recognized as genuine and the part number reported was completely distinct from the one on the bottom. Someone is changing the internal parts and returning the SSDs to amazon it seems. It is wild west to by these things at Amazon these days. I hope they do something about it.
customer_reviews.author: Y Youdi Trust This Guy

customer_reviews.title: bad support
customer_reviews.text: This was 2nd ssd from Samsung, first one did not work. This installed OK, then about 3 weeks ago kept getting chk dsk on start up. I called and they were going to send me an email with shipping instructions fro sending it in for checkup. Two weeks ago and still nothing. This morning I got a restart. The error was critical in event viewer. Support sucks!!
customer_reviews.author: jerry t

customer_reviews.title: Solid performers
customer_reviews.text: Samsung PRO SSDs are still the gold standard in the industry, especially if you need a legacy SATA drive. I just did an SSD refresh on a client's 6 workstations, solid systems with 4th-gen i7's but old mechanical HDDs, and man what a difference in speed. As expected. And I have zero concerns about them lasting 5-10+ years, with how little data they're handling on what are effectively parts lookup/ordering terminals. Just make sure you change the SATA controllers to AHCI like I forgot to, unless you're doing RAID for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B.

customer_reviews.title: Samsung PRO SSDs are the most reliable I have used.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Samsung PRO 860 256gig SSD, the first is still going strong in my home server running 24/7 for over a year. And I have an older 840 PRO that I bought years before for another computer that I am now using in that same server. My i9 gaming rig has NVME Samsung 2 and 1 TB drives in it going strong since July 2017. I always look at Samsung PRO SSDs and M.2 as a first choice for heavy use and for high performance.
customer_reviews.author: L. Segal

customer_reviews.title: They install easily. I have half dozen of the 850 series ...
customer_reviews.text: There is no comparison between these and spinning hard drives. They are very fast and use much less power in comparison. They install easily. I have half dozen of the 850 series and only one failed, and it may have received some shock before installation, however, so that does not indicate much. I will continue to purchase these - but larger capacity ones - as I add capacity to my computers/servers.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: SSD is the way to go!
customer_reviews.text: I’ll never buy another hard drive again. SSD is the only way to go. Easy to install. When my hard drive failed after only 16 months I decided I would go with a SSD instead of a traditional hard drive. No regrets. The laptop boots and shuts down much faster and programs and large files open faster as well. If you plan to do a fresh install of Windows, rather than cloning, be sure to go to Microsoft’s webpage and make a boot drive with a thumb drive before you begin the installation process, and also buy a small screwdriver kit.
customer_reviews.author: A. Santoro

customer_reviews.title: Saved me a ton of money.
customer_reviews.text: My MacBook Pro was slowing down. Took forever to do any task. I happened to need a battery, so I made the appointment at the Apple Store and while I was there I said to the tech that I think my drive is going...I have had this issue with other machines. Sure enough it fail one of the diagnostic test. So before failure, I order the Samsung SSD drive. Easy to install on a 2012 MacBook. With this upgrade, it's like having purchased a new machine. No problems to date.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher C.

customer_reviews.title: My computer runs like a dream!
customer_reviews.text: I did not do the install, so I cannot rate it personally. However, the tech who did my install was not only drooling over this little gem, but he did claim that it was a piece of cake. My computer now runs like a dream and I have no worries about running out of memory anytime soon. :) Apologies, I do not use it for gaming, so I cannot rate how it works for that activity. However, I work with 3D and digital sculpting software that are memory hogs. Smooth sailing with both types of software.
customer_reviews.author: R Shae

customer_reviews.title: excellent, slightly overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Yes, you get what you pay for, but if you can spring for the 500GB, save a few bucks extra and upgrade to the terabyte. 500 gigs is barely enough to have a proper install of windows & office, etc. and then have any space to install games or apps. Especially if you are smart and use the Samsung wizard app to over-partition to help with eventual sector failures.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Selkirk

customer_reviews.title: High performance, and so far no errors
customer_reviews.text: This is a higher quality SSD than many I've had before. The performance isn't dramatically better, but it's solid (most SSDs have a high error rate, that eventually comes to interfere or even haunt you). I also like this capacity. N.B. don't confuse this with the similar but slightly older SSD (that looks the same, has the same capacity, has a similar name) from Samsung ... this newer one certainly appears to be more reliable (per Samsung's description).
customer_reviews.author: MorganR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Read speed, Awesome Write speed
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike. From what my research has shown is that this device is very reliable, and is well supported globally. I use it for my Windows 10 OS, and it is excellent for this purpose. One of the things that I greatly appreciate is the phenomiinal Write speed: much faster than any of my previous SSDs! Win 10 shuts down INCREDIBLY fast.Excellent Read speed,
customer_reviews.author: Mike Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Brought my MacBook Pro back form the dead.
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for my Mid-2012 MacBook Pro OEM drive with a nice performance boost too. Super simple install. I recommend replacing the hard drive cable at the same time as it can also be a contributing factor to drive failure.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Extremely reliable - I have bought at least six of these over the years
customer_reviews.text: I replaced all my mechanical hard drives with these SSDs to speed things up. In every case, the results were fantastic. I have not had a single failure in over 4 years with Samsung's SSDs and recommend them highly. Also, prices have moderated over the years, so there really is no excuse for not upgrading. I'm re-stating the obvious, but you be careful to clone your old drive to these using only the best software. I use Acronis.
customer_reviews.author: Umesh Mathur

customer_reviews.title: Speedy upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: Data migration was easy with Samsung Magician software downloaded per instructions. Perfect fit. This product cut my boot up time by 80%. My 7 year old laptop has a bright future. Very fast...
customer_reviews.author: J Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my Lenovo W530 Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 1TB version for my W530 Laptop. I purchased the Pro model which is twice as expensive because of it's durability rating and slightly better speed. My previous Solid State Drive, which was also a Samsung, stopped working after 5 years, resulting in data loss, frustration, and lost time particularly since my backup didn't work. Hopefully this one will last for the remaining life of my PC. I'll let you know in 5 years!
customer_reviews.author: KendallTom

customer_reviews.title: I only buy Samsung Pro's
customer_reviews.text: Bought my first Samsung Pro all the way back when the 830 was the current drive. It's seen use in 3 desktops and read cache in a SAN. Still going strong. Amazing. I own 830's, 840's, 850's, and now this 860. None have EVER skipped a beat.
customer_reviews.author: NetMagi

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I've had some of the 850 pros for a while and wanted two more but couldn't find them for a reasonable price because the 860's had replaced them. So I got a couple of them and, yeah, they're excellent. Samsung Pro series SSDs are simply the best.
customer_reviews.author: WD

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised as a Boot Drive or Non-Boot
customer_reviews.text: I originally used this as a boot drive in my old Windows 7 machine. When I upgraded to Windows 10, I booted from elsewhere (an NVMe drive), so this is now for my data files.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handles everything I throw at it just fine and great speeds.
customer_reviews.text: Works great and great speed. Ended up getting this over the 850 Pro as the price was about the same since i got this on sale. I run my OS on this and boots up in about 5 seconds straight to desktop. Some factors will vary depending on your desktop/laptop build. I have a couple games running on this SSD and it handles them with no issues. Will update for long term use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Disgusted
customer_reviews.text: No software is included to clone your hard drive, you NEED INTERNET to download seperate software. My house having been struck by lighting over a week ago I have no internet and with no word on a fix in sight due to holidays and COVID19... so its a $100 paperweight, thats barley heavy enough to be called a paperweight. The fact they cant include the software is appalling and unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Samsung SSD
customer_reviews.text: I have several "pro" versions of Samsungs SSD. I recommend them for their extended warranty and speed over the non-pro equivalent. This time I ran into some difficulties using Samsung's data migration tool. The current version does not seem as foolproof as recent versions. Be careful or use a different tool that you are familiar with.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: For me, reliability is the most critical factor for any storage media. I have bought many Samsung Pro drives and not one has failed over 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Yoddler

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD
customer_reviews.text: I installed this inside my tower about a year ago. The SSD 225GB is still kicking it after several read/writes. I use it mostly for gaming applications. Only wish I would of bought a bigger one. Great product and the wizard that comes with it is helpful for maintenance. +Currently use it for RB6 and all my steam games
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Awsome
customer_reviews.text: A lot more expensive than other drives, but for the piece of mind knowing this is the best 2.5 inch sats drive on the market I'll take it. Plenty of space for all of my files, and the endurance to last me until my next pc. Very happy with this drive.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Working fine. No compatibility issues using it in a Toshiba ...
customer_reviews.text: Working fine. No compatibility issues using it in a Toshiba Win 8 laptop. It's working faster now with this HD drive instead of the orignal. At the beginning I used this HD on an older Toshiba Win 7 laptop, but the HD was slow, after running the Magician software for the HD, I saw there were issues with the laptop's driver compatibility, so I decided to use it on my other newer laptop & now it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Normal Dad

customer_reviews.title: So far, great!
customer_reviews.text: It's only been about 6 weeks. I put this in my older Windows 7-32 bit computer. This drive gave it new life! I also recommend the Samsung migration software. It made a perfect clone of my 2 partition start-up drive. All the software worked as before only faster and better. I use my computer primarily for business functions, but I do work with some graphics and video software and this makes the software work more smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Pic Two

customer_reviews.title: It's like having a whole new PC!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the WD Black HD C: drive with this, and it's like having a whole new PC. Installation and migration of my C: drive was a snap and now boot times are so fast I don't even have time to stretch. Windows 10 updates also install in a flash (no pun intended). Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Runkle

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for an internal SSD drive, Samsung is a very good choice. They've worked consistently for me in a work environment and at home. They have a good tool set for installation and system transfer. Like many electronics people tend to stick with what they know and that's true for me with SSD drives. Samsung works. I just don't look anywhere else, in the store or on line. I've never returned one. From an order standpoint, the package was delivered on time and in good order as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Harry J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Samsung Pro for the win!
customer_reviews.text: Successfully installed on a Mid 2012 MacBook Pro (MacBookPro9,2). Used an external HDD and time machine to do a backup then restored from the external backup to the new SSD. Read speeds went from 49 to nearly 440. I love these drives, I will never turn back to use HDD's for OS's ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Storm

customer_reviews.title: Great New Samsung 500GB Solid State Drive
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install! Bought the cables (SATA) and installed easily. I then installed Windows 10 Pro, which I bought for $5.99 on Ebay. Now my computer is running smoothly with very little money invested. The hardest part was getting the case cover off of my Acer Predator. Note: I bought the drive 3 weeks ago, and hopefully it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Metal Bender

customer_reviews.title: 4 GB of SLC SSD on a SATA chain...what's not to like other than the price itself?
customer_reviews.text: 4 gigs of single level SSD to GO. Want the best you can lay hands on? This is pretty much the bees knees if you're on a SATA chain on a machine. SPENDY. That's why it got 4 instead of 5 stars on Value for Money- you're going to pay a premium for this...but if you need it...it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Scientist

customer_reviews.title: As Expected
customer_reviews.text: Samsung SSD drives have been very reliable in my experience and as of yet this drive has not dissappointed. Instant speed improvement over the magnetic drive it replaced, Ubuntu linux runs great on it.
customer_reviews.author: vanoden

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Got to love these. They are little bit more sure, and the pro version isn't but a little bit better than the others. But the thing is, buying a Samsung Pro SSD is pretty much knowing you are going to be having a speedy reliable, no issue build. Period. Hard Desk Drives....pffffft. They are going to go extinct.
customer_reviews.author: DigiChalk

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, haven't put it to more use than making sure no DoA though. Planning on testing it more in the coming weeks and will adjust review if needed. As for now, would recommend this product. Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace the 126gb drive in my Lenovo Thinkpad T4303 laptop which was running out of room. Using Samsungs free cloning software (downloaded fro their site) the cloning my drive and installing this one was easy and quick.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Old Desktop is New Again
customer_reviews.text: Installed this tiny, but large capacity (1TB) SSD in my 10 year old HP Desktop. Loaded Linux Mint 19.2 (instead of Windows 7) - PC is now flying, almost instantaneous boot-up. Love the SSD/Linux Mint combo - goodby Windows bloatware nonsense!
customer_reviews.author: Vlad

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my ~5 yr-old ASUS laptop hard drive with this SSD. Old HD was 750GB, this one 1TB. I use this laptop for my business and personal info so I wanted something I could count on. I used Acronis to clone my HD to the SSD using a USB to SATA adapter (so it wasn't fast!). Then I replaced the HD and with some trepidation powered on the laptop. The startup was about 5X faster! I've used the new SSD now for about a month and am very pleased at the performance improvement. I recommend this SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Knoch

customer_reviews.title: Fast & Power Efficient
customer_reviews.text: I had an 850 Pro running Windows 10 for a while now without an issue. Drive is super fast and power efficient. I got this 860 Pro to run Manjaro Linux and man, this thing is fast. Boots to desktop in under 10sec, and restarts / standy in less than 3sec on an older x79 platform. No cons. Great drive
customer_reviews.author: B. Obama

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't own anything else
customer_reviews.text: This whole Samsung SSD is the ONLY way to go. Samsung has cornered the market on reliability of all its memory production, regardless of SD cards, or SS drives. Wouldn't own anything else, of anything requiring memory.
customer_reviews.author: j. Michael O'Hara

customer_reviews.title: Ps4 pro external drive
customer_reviews.text: I used this product in an external drive compartment on a ps4 pro and it has really cut down load screens by a large margin and was very easy to install and format I will probably buy a 1 terabyte drive for the internal drive
customer_reviews.author: Donald K schofield

customer_reviews.title: Amazing performance but I had one that failed on me.
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these. One of them has failed within a year. Used within a desktop gaming PC and a laptop gaming PC. I love the performance of these SSDs but that one that failed really hurt my wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Sin'Jin

customer_reviews.title: Great Internal Solid State Drive
customer_reviews.text: 860 EVO Pro better for enterprise not everday use. Its really good. But if you want to use it for normal purpose it's better you buy 860 EVO not 860 EVO Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Papkov

customer_reviews.title: Good quality SSD
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best SSD I have ever used. The installation was quick and was able to migrate the data from my old Hard Drive to this one, using Samsung Magician software. This SSD is a bit pricey but value every single penny.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to maximize my PS4 Pro
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Spider-man edition PS4 and it was worth it the system over all got x10 faster and more responsive with this hard drive! Great buy! Worth every penny 🤙, recommend if you have a ps4 pro and want to add some internal storage plus overall performance, instead of an external hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Actuallychrisalva

customer_reviews.title: Great Performance, but issues Migrating Data
customer_reviews.text: Issues trying to Clone the drive from 840 PRO to 860 PRO using Samsung's Data Migration. Several attempts made, always got hung up at 99% which was frustrating. Ended up using Macrium Reflect to clone and it went smoothly. After successful cloning and setting up the new 860 PRO as the boot drive, it has performed up to expectations. I am satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Lopez

customer_reviews.title: The best performing SSD
customer_reviews.text: I use the product for personal reasons when my 12 year old WD 150GB Velociraptor bit the dust for the 2nd time.. but this time out of the 5 year warranty. I have several other Samsung SSDs in my two PCs that I built. Totally awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Speedi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: It's really fast and works great as a hard drive replacement in laptops. I'm using it in my 2011 MacBook Pro on Catalina without a single problem. I even have TRIM support and everything. This is actually the second one I've bought.
customer_reviews.author: RasPiCase

customer_reviews.title: Solid drives work fine
customer_reviews.text: Bought 6 of these to use with our Shogun Inferno. They were recommended to us, and they initialize flawlessly, and we've had no issues writing 4K RAW from our FS5 into them.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Freese

customer_reviews.title: Boot drive upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. Upgraded an older windows machine with this SSD as the boot drive and what a difference! Literally takes 1/3 of the time to boot.
customer_reviews.author: EG

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! That is all. I took the cheap SSDs that came with my computers and out this drive in and OMG it made a powerful and significant impact to the performance of my computers. This SSD is truly amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Greetings from Florida

customer_reviews.title: This SSD is the BOMB!!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot believe the performance of this little SSD. We replaced original HD in 2 Dell laptops, and what a difference! SO easy to install, using Samsung software (downloaded from their site). Just connect to USB port, "clone" your old drive, install this new one and then boot back up ... within 8 seconds Win10 is ready! Highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Try a different name

customer_reviews.title: Fatal Error
customer_reviews.text: Fatal error was found and the ssd couldn't even be read.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica Monique

customer_reviews.title: Very fast. Easy to clone an internal bootable drive to it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clone my internal Samsung SSD in anticipation of its eventual failure. Cloning the internal drive was quick and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent traveller

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best!!
customer_reviews.text: Talk about speed. Samsung makes the best ssd ever. I did a speed test and oh man off the charts. It was pretty easy to install. The results are instant. My laptop and everything else loads so fast. Keep up the good work!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ville

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: It comes with it's own migration too, so you can just move your HDD to your SSD. All but one program moved over with no problem. The one program that didn't do well was fixed eventually
customer_reviews.author: Isai Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer
customer_reviews.text: I use several of these as primary drives and have never had any problems. Easy to install and always perform very well.
customer_reviews.author: DPaul

customer_reviews.title: Revived mid-2012 Macbook Pro!
customer_reviews.text: Along with a RAM upgrade, this brought the boot time on my mid-2012 Macbook Pro (A1278) down from 1 min 20 sec to 15 sec.
customer_reviews.author: Apicius

customer_reviews.title: Extremely fast
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to spend out the extra money for the 860 Pro over the 860 Evo, but I'm glad I did. It is extremely fast and made very short work of a large video import and editing project I was working on. I have a feeling rendering and saving videos would have been quite a bit slower on any other drive.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This ssd is Better, faster and reliable, I always buy Samsung ssd's they are very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Redeyejedi

customer_reviews.title: Old SSD was failing
customer_reviews.text: replaced a 256G MSata and 512G HDD in my Lenovo X230 because the MSata was failing. Never had an issue with Samsung. This will probably outlast the PC.
customer_reviews.author: MarkD

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: Good ssd although very expensive and after a year its noticeably slower, but what isn't slower after a year?
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Desktop windows 10 login time went from ~2 minutes to maybe 10 seconds.  Not exaggerating.
customer_reviews.text: Desktop windows 10 login time went from ~2 minutes to maybe 10 seconds. Not exaggerating. Used a startech disk cloner, loaded up in partition magic, expanded the partition to take up the entire drive and now it FLIES.
customer_reviews.author: Elias A.

customer_reviews.title: A solid drive (no pun intended!)
customer_reviews.text: Great read and write speeds, I've used Samsung SSDs for years and never had a problem with any of them. The only spinning drives I use now are in servers (RAID6) for capacity. I could not think of building a system (of upgrading one) and using a standard disk.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rivett

customer_reviews.title: Great storage and fast
customer_reviews.text: I had an 850 pro with a capacity of 256mb but ran out of room, so I bought this SSD and it doesn't disappoint. Its plenty fast even though its not M.2 and you'd be hard pressed to notice the difference, price was right too.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M

customer_reviews.title: As usual Samsung's SSDs are reliable and deliver the best performance.
customer_reviews.text: Switching from a 128GB 840 PRO to 256GB 860 Pro both for extra storage space for the OS drive and for the boost in performance, every thing went perfect, from installation to moving OS from old drive to the new drive, to the out put performance that meets the expectations form a Samsung SSD. The only thing that would be better than this one is the Samsung M2 version. Would totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: POP3D

customer_reviews.title: Supper fast for me
customer_reviews.text: Very fast. For myself made my computer boot up in 20 seconds. This might not be you case but it works great in mine
customer_reviews.author: Theodore F. Beck III

customer_reviews.title: Works in my toughbook
customer_reviews.text: Faster and much more energy efficient than my old steam powered drive. Trust Samsung for the best memory.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonaddict

customer_reviews.title: Fast, reliable storage.
customer_reviews.text: I've used Samsung PRO SSDs in everything from workstations to mission-critical servers. Always happy with the performance, and haven't seen a failure yet!
customer_reviews.author: Doof

customer_reviews.title: SSD 860 PRO 6GB
customer_reviews.text: Wow is this thing fast. One minute to boot with old hard drive, now it's 7 seconds. Well worth it. It's like getting a new desktop. If you get one go to Samsung's website and download Magician. You'll be surprised as to how well this drive performs.
customer_reviews.author: Beatleman

customer_reviews.title: Fast performance but expensive
customer_reviews.text: If you are upgrading from an HDD to the Samsung Pro SSD, I guarantee that you will see a very notable boot speed difference in your computer. It runs very well, though you might need to purchase a case that would fit the SSD in your PC. Overall, it’s a very good product. Would be nice if SSD prices were cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Will

product_meta.title: Samsung SSD 860 PRO 2TB 2.5 Inch SATA III Internal SSD (MZ-76P2T0BW)
product_meta.description: Capacity:2TBIndustry leading reliability: Powered by the latest V-NAND technology and a robust algorithm-based controller, the Samsung 860 PRO SSD readily handles heavy workloads of high-end PCs, workstations and NAS (Network Attached Systems) to give lasting assurance to gamers, IT and creative professionals. Speeds are consistent and sustained, even under heavy workloads and multitasking. The 860 PRO Solid State Drive performs at sequential read speeds up to 560MB/s with the combination of the latest V-NAND and a refined controller, delivering sequential write speeds up to 530MB/s. The smart compatibility of the SSD lets you benefit from faster, more fluid communication with your host system. The refined ECC algorithm and a new MJX controller generate higher speeds, and the improved queued trim enhances Linux compatibility. Reliability - Humidity- 5% to 95% non-condensing
feature_bullets: INNOVATIVE V-NAND TECHNOLOGY: Powered by Samsung V-NAND Technology, the 860 PRO SSD offers optimized performance for everyday computing as well as rendering large-sized 4K videos and 3D data used by the latest applications
ENHANCED READ WRITE SPEEDS: Sequential read and write performance levels of up to 560MB/s and 530MB/s, respectively
SECURE ENCRYPTION: Protect data by selecting security options, including AES 256-bit hardware-based encryption compliant with TCG Opal and IEEE 1669
WARRANTY AND COMPATIBILITY: 5-year limited warranty; Windows 8/Windows 7/Windows Server 2003 (32 bit and 64 bit), Vista (SP1 and above), XP (SP2 and above), MAC OSX and Linux
INCLUDED CONTENTS: 2.5 inches (7 millimeter) SATA 3 (6 Gb/s) SSD & User Manual (All other cables, screws, brackets not included); Reliability (MTBF): 1.5 Million Hours Reliability (MTBF)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars880 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
